page.title: 05ROYAL SHREWSBURY HOSPITAL.
page.content: People from all over Shropshire and Mid Wales come to the Royal Shrewsbury Hospital for treatment. The oldest part, Shelton, is a large Psychiatric hospital. In 1938 the Americans built Copthorne South, which was originally used for wounded soldiers, but is now a busy general hospital with 389 beds. Copthorne South has 2 children's wards and will soon have the 'Tiny Tim Playroom' built with money raised during the filming of 'A Christmas Carol' in Shrewsbury in 1984. The Maternity hospital is on the same site as the new Copthorne North, which was opened by Prince Charles in 1978. A cobalt unit, costing Â£100,000 was built in 1982.
